item.title: DA's need to be equally as accountable as Law Enforcement. ...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

DA's need to be equally as accountable as Law Enforcement.
They are peace officers. In fact, 33% of all exonerations resulted from DA misconduct. #CAAPV is working to introduce a bill in the 2021 legislative session that will hold DA's Accountable (no more absolute immunity) and will publicize their discovery violations. Please email CAAPV at

nomoredaimmunity@gmail.com

...

with your DA discovery violation stories, include as much as you feel comfortable: your name, the DA's name, jurisdiction, your name, name of client, case number and circumstances.

See More

law.umich.edu

www.law.umich.edu
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: And for this week’s #CAAPV #DidYouKnow: The use of ketamine...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

And for this week’s #CAAPV #DidYouKnow:

The use of ketamine by Colorado paramedics and EMTs responding to calls from the police is not unusual, and needs to be stopped.

This powerful anesthetic is administered to persons purportedly exhibiting “excited delirium,” although the American Medical Association, the American Psychiatric Association, and the World Health Organization do not recognize “excited delirium” as a disorder, and the diagnosis has been decried as junk science.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Violent cop 101: when you murder someone, “make him a suspect.”

#HoldCopsAccountable #DefundPolice #EndPoliceMurder #CAAPV

item.title: This officer will lose 30 days of work for punching someone in...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

This officer will lose 30 days of work for punching someone in the face and for using a Taser while the person was already in handcuffs. Things the rest of us could be charged with felonies for. A badge should not justify violence.

#HoldCopsAccountable #DefundThePolice #CAAPV #EndPoliceViolence

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-police-use-of-force-t…/…

A Denver police officer will lose 30 days of work for unnecessarily punching a man in the face and then Tasing the man in the back after he was already handcuffed.

denverpost.com

Denver police officer suspended for Tasing man in the back after he was handcuffed

item.title: Sadler “made the whole thing up” in response to “stress...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Sadler “made the whole thing up” in response to “stress [that] was related to the environment law enforcement was facing, including protests in Denver, a nationwide movement for police reform and the passage of Senate Bill 217, a police accountability measure passed by the Colorado Legislature.”

#HoldCopsAccountable #SB217 #CAAPV

https://kdvr.com/…/arapahoe-county-sheriffs-deputy-charged…/

An Arapahoe County sheriff’s deputy has been suspended without pay for allegedly faking a threat to himself.

kdvr.com

Arapahoe County sheriff’s deputy charged with false reporting

item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: Proud of #CAAPV’s own Jes Jones for speaking out against...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Proud of #CAAPV’s own Jes Jones for speaking out against DPD’s efforts to violently silence protesters, and grateful for the work of National Lawyers Guild of Colorado for their work to protect protestors against DPD’s relentless violence.

In the National Lawyers Guild statement, Jones takes on Polis for implying that protesters are criminal terrorists: "To have the Governor of Colorado equate property destruction as terrorism yet refuse to condemn police killings of unarmed... Black men is unacceptable. Property can be replaced, Black Lives cannot," she maintains.

...

“The arrests are violent, resulting in broken bones and other serious injuries. The criminal charges are being inflated to increasingly serious offenses. Protesters are being forced to risk their safety and freedom in order to exercise their right to free speech," said Jessica Jones — a local criminal defense attorney and volunteer organizer for the Colorado NLG. "It is a sad paradox that protesters experience police violence as they protest police violence."

In addition to violent policing tactics in the name of crowd-control, Denver Police recently began invoking a little-used ordinance that was originally passed in anticipation of the 2008 Democratic National Convention protests. The law bans activists from carrying protective equipment, chains, and bike locks.

"This ordinance has allowed police to criminalize activists before a protest has even started," said Jones.

https://www.westword.com/…/denver-protest-arrests-likened-t…

See MorePossession of a helmet can allegedly lead to an arrest.

westword.com

Claim: Denver Police Busting Protesters for Protecting Themselves

Possession of a helmet can allegedly lead to an arrest.Possession of a helmet can allegedly lead to an arrest.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: “The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment,...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

“The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment, which issues waivers to departments so they can use the sedative in that manner, in July reopened an investigation into McClain’s case and, in September, into the use of the substance by paramedics statewide. Paramedics have used ketamine in an EMS setting more than 900 times in the past three years, according to the department.”

https://www.denverpost.com/…/elijah-mcclain-ketamine-ban-a…/

Aurora City Council banned the city’s emergency responders from using ketamine until an independent investigation into the death of Elijah McClain is complete.

denverpost.com

Aurora bans emergency responders’ use of ketamine until Elijah McClain investigation complete

Aurora City Council banned the city’s emergency responders from using ketamine until an independent investigation into the death of Elijah McClain is complete.Aurora City Council banned the city’s emergency responders from using ketamine until an independent investigation into the death of Elijah McClain is complete.

item.title: “When police officers openly discuss with one another their...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

“When police officers openly discuss with one another their disdain for one group of citizens that they are sworn to serve and protect, and make jokes about killing those citizens for ‘paid vacation leave,’ they normalize police misconduct and murder,” Schielke said in a statement. “Cop jokes about some lives not mattering inevitably fosters a culture of police officers who are much more willing to pull the trigger on those same lives later.”

https://www.denverpost.com/…/hells-angels-lawsuit-settleme…/

Five Colorado police agencies paid $25,000 and issued an apology to a Hells Angels member after an officer two years ago joked that he’d shoot the man to get “paid vacation.”

denverpost.com

Hells Angels member gets $25,000, apology from Colorado cop who joked about shooting him to get “paid vacation”

Five Colorado police agencies paid $25,000 and issued an apology to a Hells Angels member after an officer two years ago joked that he’d shoot the man to get “paid vacation.”Five Colorado police agencies paid $25,000 and issued an apology to a Hells Angels member after an officer two years ago joked that he’d shoot the man to get “paid vacation.”

item.title: And for this week's #CAAPV #DidYouKnow: even when someone...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

And for this week's #CAAPV #DidYouKnow: even when someone charged with a crime "wins," their lives are never the same, nor are their pocketbooks.

If we are to #HoldCopsAccountable, we must remember that #DAsAreCopsToo and work to hold them accountable, too.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: What happened? The officer lost two days of pay, and will be...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

What happened? The officer lost two days of pay, and will be back on the street responding to our vulnerable citizens, including victims of domestic violence. #CAAPV #HoldCopsAccountable #DefundThePolice

“Cochran then responded in a text: “I’ll bet if I beat your ass on the regular, you’d be incapable of staying away from me.”

Cochran, who joined the department in 2017, told internal affairs investigators that the woman had confided in him that she had been in unhealthy rela...tionships in the past and that he was trying to “indicate he was better than the previous men she had dated,” his disciplinary letter states. He said the text he sent was poorly worded.”

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-police-domestic-viole…/…

See MoreA Denver police officer will lose two days of pay for telling a woman who said she did not want to go on a second date that he bet she would be interested in him if he beat her.

denverpost.com

Denver police officer disciplined for suggesting that a woman would be interested in dating him if he beat her

A Denver police officer will lose two days of pay for telling a woman who said she did not want to go on a second date that he bet she would be interested in him if he beat her.A Denver police officer will lose two days of pay for telling a woman who said she did not want to go on a second date that he bet she would be interested in him if he beat her.

item.title: Let. Kids. Learn. “Having toys in my house is something I...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Let. Kids. Learn.

“Having toys in my house is something I thought I never had to think of,” she said. “It never crossed my mind that toys could be seen as a threat.”

https://apple.news/AIgMWgS5pSSaNrhyAGxEiSQ

"How do I protect my son, what do I have him do [when] playing with a toy in the privacy of your own home is a threat?" the 7th grader's mother told BuzzFeed News.

apple.news

A Colorado School Suspended A 12-Year-Old Black Boy And Called The Police To His Home After He Waved A Toy Gun During A Virtual Class — BuzzFeed News

"How do I protect my son, what do I have him do [when] playing with a toy in the privacy of your own home is a threat?" the 7th grader's mother told BuzzFeed News."How do I protect my son, what do I have him do [when] playing with a toy in the privacy of your own home is a threat?" the 7th grader's mother told BuzzFeed News.

item.title: Roughly 14% of DPD’s dispatch was for violent crime (which,...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Roughly 14% of DPD’s dispatch was for violent crime (which, mind you, includes “riots”), which account for about 17% of officer’s time on the street.

Do not succumb to the fearmongering that if we defund the police that we will be unsafe. It’s simply untrue.

#CAAPV #DefundThePolice #AbolitionNow

...

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-police-officer-time-jo…/

See MoreThough violent crime generates the most headlines, Denver’s patrol officers spent more than 80% of their time dealing with other less serious complaints and a wide array of community tasks.

denverpost.com

How do cops spend their time? As Denver debates police funding, these numbers offer an inside look

Though violent crime generates the most headlines, Denver’s patrol officers spent more than 80% of their time dealing with other less serious complaints and a wide array of community tasks.Though violent crime generates the most headlines, Denver’s patrol officers spent more than 80% of their time dealing with other less serious complaints and a wide array of community tasks.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: From Laurie Kepros. Stand in solidarity Thursday, 9/24, #CAAPV! ...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

From Laurie Kepros. Stand in solidarity Thursday, 9/24, #CAAPV!

“In case it interests, THURSDAY 9/24/20 from 8am to 2pm, there will be a protest at the 10th Circuit in Denver in opposition to the court's August decision in Millard erroneously finding Colorado's sex offender registry is not punishment. For more details contact WAR at the email address below. All are welcome, masks are encouraged:
On Thursday, September 24, 2020, Women Against Registry and others dedicated to ...change in America’s sexual offense registration laws will be in front of the 10th Circuit Appeals Court building from 8 AM to 2 PM to protest the 10th Circuit’s ruling. The message is simple – the registry IS punishment. As we know it has altered the lives of human beings who merely want to have their lives fully restored.

We invite each and every person experiencing the punitiveness and stigma of registration to join us. Each man, woman or child can make a difference. Begin right now making plans to be part of the demonstration and/or donating to the initiative to help with travel, lodging, materials and brochures which are being designed as we speak. It will be a great time to meet others from like-minded organizations and be a part of something BIG!
Let us know if you will be joining us so that we can keep you apprised of on-going plans and developments.

For more information, contact... 10thcirteam@warfamilyfoundation.org”

See More
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: After 23 years, 6 trials, and four death sentences all secured...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

After 23 years, 6 trials, and four death sentences all secured through deplorable prosecutorial misconduct, Curtis is free. And thankfully living proof of why our states are not equipped to kill.

https://www.apmreports.org/…/charges-against-curtis-flowers…

The Mississippi man who was tried six times for the same crime and whose case was the subject of Season 2 of the APM Reports podcast In the Dark sees his two-decade saga come to an end.

apmreports.org

Charges against Curtis Flowers are dropped

The Mississippi man who was tried six times for the same crime and whose case was the subject of Season 2 of the APM Reports podcast In the Dark sees his two-decade saga come to an end.The Mississippi man who was tried six times for the same crime and whose case was the subject of Season 2 of the APM Reports podcast In the Dark sees his two-decade saga come to an end.

item.title: Thanks to the Denver Westword for covering our...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Thanks to the Denver Westword for covering our #DecarcerationDayOfAction Rally yesterday, and for spreading the word that a jail or prison sentence should not be a death sentence, and that Governor Jared Polis should act to bring our neighbors home.

https://www.westword.com/…/colorado-prison-governor-release…

#decarcerationday #FreeThemAll #covidjustice #carenotcages #endmassincarceration #COVIDcolorado #doyourpart #bringourneighborshome #redemptionisreal #clemencyiscompassion #CAAPV

Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.
